instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board 820-3478 (clean), only 1 led with iMac supply.
I use an external power supply, I inject 12V on PP12V_ACDC, the current is 0,77A
I think it's too much, I have U2800 is very hot, PP1V05_TBTLC=0,3V, I suspect U2800. PP3V3_TBTLC=3,3V.
have you an idea?

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
Did you inject directly on the J6900 pins?
If you get S5 LED on with iMac PSU, should get it with lab PSU too.
Test again with original PSU.

Q8450/70 fails a lot on this board.
Q8470 should be good now, if you get steady 12V_S5.

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message: Yes I inject by J6900, I have the 1st led too on PSU. I check the Q8450/70 later.

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
hi,
Q8470 is good, I have 12V_S5. and 8470 too.
PP3V42_G3H=3,41V, S3,S4,S5 is OK.
I have PM_EN_REG_P1V05_S0=0V why? need the real iMac power supply?
thanks

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message: Do you get the 3 voltages referred to pins 9 & 10 of U8600?

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
PM_PGOOD_REG_GPU_VDDQ_S0 (pin 10) = 3,3V
PM_PGOOD_FET_REG_P1V5_S0 = 3,3V
PM_EN_REG_P1V05_S0_R = 0V
I try to find why PM_PGOOD_REG_GPU_VDDQ_S0 at 0.

I check that, I change U7700 but always same:
PP1V5R1V35_S0_GPU_REG = 0V
PM_EN_REG_GPU_VDDQ_S0 = 3,3V
PP5V_S0_REG_FBVDDQ=5V

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
If U8600 has 3V at pins 9/10, then must have 3V at pin 8 too.
If not, change U8600.

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
Hi,
sorry no I have 3,3V on pin 9 and 0V on pin 10.
I check that for the pin 10:
PM_EN_REG_GPU_VDDQ_S0 = 3,3V
PM_PGOOD_REG_FBVDDQ_S0 = PM_PGOOD_REG_FBVDDQ_S0 = 0V
PP5V_S0_REG_FBVDDQ=5V
I change U7750 but always same

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message: Do you get correct voltage at L7710?

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
No I have 0V
Diode mode 0,0084V, short?

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
Check resistance in ohm mode, instead of diode mode; preferred method for low values.

"P5V_S0_REG_FBVD=5V"
Looks like broken trace to 5V_S0.

Be sure no short to ground at pins 19/20 of U7750.

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
L7710 = 0,0084V in diode mode, i compare with another same board (0,450V).
can I inject power? to find short? how can I do?
pins 19/20 of U7750 are OK (0,5V in diode mode)

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
I said to post ohm value.
If you have around 10 ohm there, voltage injection will not help probably.

What about missing 5V at U7750, don't you want to fix that first?

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
i have the 5V, why do you tell me about 5V.
I think it's the GPU because he heat when I inject a small current (1V 0,8A)

threads.title: 820-3478 1st led, noise HDD nothing more
threads.message:
My error, I was thinking to miss voltage there...

If ohm resistance to ground is such low, comparing with good board, then you have bad GPU...
